revised_title: Hydrolysis of Cane Sugar by Sulphuric Acid and Polarimetric Apparatus Improvements
tldr: The author investigates the hydrolysis of cane sugar by sulfuric acid and observes the effects of concentration on the reaction rate. They also discuss improvements in polarimetric apparatus used to measure the optical rotation of sugar solutions. The study finds that the reaction rate increases with decreasing water-to-acid ratio, and the author suggests that the change in concentration mainly affects the acid's activity.
